terms.definition: A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems for users or customers.
Technology or platforms that use artificial intelligence to automate processes, provide intelligent suggestions, or enhance functionality without manual intervention.
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted by a provider and accessed via the internet through subscription.
A text editing tool that allows users to write content using Markdown syntax, which converts plain text formatting into HTML for web display.
Comprehensive written materials that explain how to use, implement, or maintain a software product, including user guides, API docs, and technical specifications.
Web-based platforms that organize and present information, documentation, and resources in an accessible, searchable format for users.
Dynamic documentation platforms that allow users to engage with content through search, feedback, comments, and real-time updates.
Software that enables multiple team members to work together on projects, documents, or tasks simultaneously with shared access and editing capabilities.
The process of organizing, maintaining, updating, and controlling access to technical documents and knowledge resources within an organization.
Individuals or groups who have an interest in or are affected by a project, including team members, customers, managers, and end users.
Data-driven conclusions or recommendations that can be directly implemented to improve processes, user experience, or business outcomes.
A billing model where customers pay for software or services once per year, typically offering cost savings compared to monthly payments.
A subscription agreement that locks in pricing and service terms for multiple years, often requiring upfront payment for extended discounts.
Additional features, modules, or services that can be purchased separately to extend the functionality of a base software product.
A payment method where the full amount for a service or subscription is paid in advance, often in exchange for discounts or special terms.
